intro: Henckelia elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed henckelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
